question: where is south pole located on a map
vanilla_rag_result: The South Pole is located at the geographic South Pole, which is situated on the continent of Antarctica. On a map, it is depicted as the southernmost point on Earth, directly opposite the North Pole. It is positioned at an elevation of 2,835 meters (9,300 feet) above sea level, atop a thick ice sheet, and is approximately 1,300 kilometers (800 miles) from the nearest open sea at the Bay of Whales.
